Issue #30 Citroën CX 2400 GTI 1981 J. Ickx/C. Brasseur

The 1981 Dakar departed from Trocadéro in Paris on January 1 and took competitors through France, Algeria, Mali, Upper Volta, Ivory Coast, and finishing in Dakar, Senegal on January 20 for a total of 2,086 miles.

Citroën entered 5 Citroën CX 2400 GTIs in the 1981 Dakar with one those driven by the team of Jacky Ickx and Claude Brasseur. Jacky was well-known as a four-time winner of the Le Mans 24 hour Grand Prix and Claude was not quite as well-known formerly racing go-karts.

In their first outing they claimed a win in stage 11 after suffering suspension problems in stage 5. This was the high-point of their rally as they had to retire in the next stage after a spectacular roll-over.
